item.title: Kai Kupferschmidt
item.description:
WHO has just declared the rise in #mpox cases a public health emergency of international concern (#PHEIC). "The detection and rapid spread of a new clade of mpox in eastern DRC, its detection in neighboring countries that had not previously reported mpox, and the potential for further spread within Africa and beyond is very worrying",
WHO's director general Tedros said in the presser just now.

item.title: Electronic Frontier Foundation
item.description: EFF is back in court trying to make sure patent litigation is transparent as possible. https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2024/08/eff-presses-federal-circuit-make-patent-case-filings-public

item.title: ProjectFearlessness
item.description:
‘I won’t be on here as long as the owner is a far right freak who whines about the "right" to incite race riots, promotes violent racist extremists who incite them, and post racist memes himself.'Steve Peers,
Professor of EU Law,
University of London.#TwitterExodushttps://www.lawgazette.co.uk/news/high-profile-lawyers-quit-twitter-in-disgust-at-musk/5120616.article

item.title: Dan Gillmor
item.description: The latest test of journalism -- which our political press will surely fail -- is tomorrow's Trump "press conference" at another of his properties.Trump knows he can manipulate the media with impunity, because our media are begging to be manipulated.

item.title: The Conversation U.S.
item.description:
“The U.S. #SupremeCourt is deregulating corruption, with arguably grim consequences for American democracy.”Analysis by a professor of law who explains how SCOTUS is making it much harder for federal prosecutors to go after corrupt state and local officials:
https://theconversation.com/this-supreme-court-has-redefined-the-meaning-of-corruption-233424
#USPolitics #News #Law

item.title: Muirén NíSídach
item.description:
If this were a pregnant white woman, there would be a firestorm of outrage coast to coast, even if she was armed and threatened the life of a police officer.But an unarmed, pregnant Black woman only "suspected" of a petty thief, and posing no threat is put down like a dangerous animal.This is not a few bad apples, or a police problem, it's the manufactured culture of #whiteness and the state-sponsored racial class system that cultivates and defends it.Ohio Cop Charged with Murdering 21-Year-Old Pregnant Black Mother Ta’Kiya Young
#BlackMastodon #whiteTerrorism #Police #StateViolence
https://www.democracynow.org/2024/8/14/headlines/ohio_cop_charged_with_murdering_21_year_old_pregnant_black_mother_takiya_young

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: The double standards of the US press have been glaring: Trump's age vs. Biden's, using hacked materials from Trump's or Clinton's campaign.https://www.editorialboard.com/kamala-harris-is-taking-power-back-from-the-press-corps/

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description:
My colleague Ben Mueller and I have new stories out this afternoon about intriguing new studies of the brain. Ben writes about an implant that allows someone with ALS to talk. I write about how a quarter of unresponsive people with brain injuries might actually capable of sustained cognition—and might benefit from those implants, too.
Gift links: Ben: https://nyti.ms/4cnatO5 Me: https://nyti.ms/4dntRfd

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
Research Into Unconsciousness Could Make Anesthesia Safer
https://www.anesthesiologynews.com/Medical-Monitor/Article/09-24/Research-Into-Unconsciousness-Could-Make-Anesthesia-Safer/74571

item.title: Jason Lefkowitz
item.description: “To put it baldly most elite DC journalists treated Harris with a kind of breezy disdain that could scarcely rise to the level of contempt. For the first year of her vice presidency there were an on-going series of critical reports about turmoil in the office, staff drama, mean bossism. I don’t know how much reality there was to those reports. But they set a dismal tone. When the calls for a Thunderdome convention came Ezra Klein referred delicately to ‘the Kamala Harris problem,’ a problem so obvious it scarcely required explanation: how to usher her out of the way for others.”https://talkingpointsmemo.com/edblog/kamala-a-riddle-wrapped-in-a-mystery-inside-an-enigma-many-people-are-saying#USPol

item.title: Steve Herman
item.description: Columbia University's president resigns after months of controversy about how she responded to campus protests over the Israel-Hamas war. https://www.columbiaspectator.com/news/2024/08/14/shafik-resigns-from-presidency/

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: ^ Thinking about the article describing the mood amongst Israelis. There is unlikely to be any way to persuade them - too far gone. A hard break in support for Israel's policies will likely be necessary.

item.title: JuneSim63
item.description:
"As Rusi explains, the UK has a genuine two-tier justice system. It treats some people – white, non-Muslim – as though they act from blind anger, and others – Brown, Muslim – as coordinated terrorists, even when they commit the same crimes:
George Monbiot on the reality of the British two-tier justice system.#Justice #Law #TwoTierJustice #UKPolitics #UKRiots #Terrorism
#Islamophobia #JustStopOil #Protestshttps://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/article/2024/aug/14/peaceful-protest-punished-britain-racist-rioting-real-two-tier-justice?CMP=GTUK_email

item.title: d a t green
item.description: Why Thierry Breton’s letter to X may be the EU’s “Stanley Baldwin moment”The commissioner’s stark warning to Elon Musk was a rare example of those with public power standing up to media and commercial interestsBy me, at Prospecthttps://www.prospectmagazine.co.uk/ideas/law/67590/thierry-bretons-letter-to-x-may-be-the-eus-stanley-baldwin-moment

item.title: Peter Gleick
item.description:
Trump just had a rally at the Thomas Wolf Auditorium in Asheville, NC, with 2400 seats.
Lol.
I gave a keynote address three days ago on the future of water to an audience of 2500. Just saying...
